p: In addition to the severe shortages of PPE and other medical equipment, which have been discussed ad nauseam during this pandemic, several drug shortages have developed, which will be of paramount importance when we begin to return to our practices after the pandemic. From the current trends in usage globally, the following drugs are likely to be affected: oxygen, propofol, midazolam, fentanyl, antibiotics, muscle relaxants, and steroids. Treatment of patients with COVID-19 requires the delivery of oxygen as the main treatment, which has implications for the functioning of hospitals and ambulatory surgery centers. One should consider the possible delays that could occur from supply chain interruptions and prepare accordingly.
